title: Grizzly Peak 2014 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)
description: This is a spicy aromatic wine, with potent aromas of vanilla and black tea. The red fruits are compressed, and there is a big streak of coffee liqueur running across the palate. It's got plenty of flavor, though what is grape and what is barrel remains a bit of a puzzle.

title: Gypsy Dancer 2014 Christine's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The blend is principally Pommard, focusing on ripe berry-fruit flavors, along with streaks of citrus. The barrel aging adds a light vein of dark chocolate.

title: Hugel 2016 Gentil White (Alsace)
description: Fresh, ripe apple, lemon and pear are on full display on the open nose. The palate balances this abundance with a pleasantly bitter, tangy note. This is dry, slender and refreshing, with a layered, stony core.

title: I/G 2016 Riesling (Rogue Valley)
description: This full and fruity wine offers generous flavors of tangy apple and peach. Though technically dry at 5 g/l of residual sugar, it hints at a light dusting of sweet powder, which helps to cut down on the acidity. In any event, it drinks quite well and is ready for near-term enjoyment.

title: J. Christopher 2015 Charlie's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This cuvée gets off to a good start with rich scents and flavors of strawberry jam, along with ripe plum and cherry highlights. There's a fairly strong herbal component, with a stemmy note that comes out more strongly in the finish as it fades away.

title: Jerusalem Wineries 2014 4990 Reserve Petite Sirah (Judean Hills)
description: This wine offers a bouquet of black currant, cherry and black olive. The tannins come on strong but never overpower the rich flavors of black cherry, blackberry, thyme and anise. Strawberry and eucalyptus tones show on finish.

title: Jerusalem Wineries 2016 2900 Cabernet Sauvignon (Judean Hills)
description: Aromas of dark plum and pomegranate lead into flavors of wood, blueberry, vanilla and anise. This wine is full in the mouth, with softly lingering tannins and a bright finish of baking spices.

title: Karl Josef 2016 Piesporter Michelsberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Smoke and crushed slate juxtapose punchy yellow peach and nectarine in this crisp, cutting spätlese. Delicately honeyed yet invigoratingly fresh, it finishes on a lip-smacking tangerine tone. Drink now through 2020.

title: La Montina 2007 Baiana Pas Dosé Riserva  (Franciacorta)
description: Toast, oak, bread crust and graphite aromas lead the way. It's vibrant but rather lean, offering roasted nut, coffee, dried apple slice and a note of lemon rind before a dry finish. Fresh acidity and small beading lend elegance.

title: Lion Ranch 2015 Two Lions Red (Central Coast)
description: Blackberry jam, tangy plum skins, pepper and sagebrush show on the nose of this blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah. The palate reveals tart hibiscus, cranberry and the slightest dusting of dried herbs, all presented with decent acidic energy.

title: Lismore 2015 Viognier (Greyton)
description: Soft, toasty notes of apple skin, creamed melon and orange peel greet the nose and carry through to the medium-weight palate, where they're met with additional hints of melon rind and baking spice. A pithy texture lends length to the close. Drink now.

title: Majolini NV Blanc de Noir Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Bread crust, acacia honey and dried herb aromas lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers up dried apricot, mature red apple, candied citrus slice and a hint of toasted nut alongside lively beading.

title: Markham 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a hearty version of the variety, blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Petite Sirah. Black licorice, Dr. Pepper and densely rich, extracted black cherry and blueberry accent a full-bodied softly textured palate of approachability.

title: Monogram NV Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas suggesting white stone fruit, citrus blossom and bread crust waft out of the glass. On the lively palate, a vigorous perlage and bright acidity underscore yellow apple, citrus zest and chopped herb. A note of bitter almond marks the close.

title: Preiss-Zimmer 2016 Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A savory touch of undergrowth blends in with the tart, fresh cherry scent on the nose. The same savory and fruity combination dominates the palate. This offers tart cherry fruit, a fine crunch tannins and ample, bright acidity on the light body.

title: Raats Family 2015 Red Jasper Red (Stellenbosch)
description: This Cabernet Franc-led blend, with 36% Malbec, 9% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot, opens with seductive notes of dried cherry, cocoa-dusted raspberry, vanilla bean and sweet oak. There's ample tannic structure, though they are quite fleeting, allowing the vibrant acidity and bright red-fruit flavors to shine through. Drink now–2021.

title: Rocca di Montemassi 2016 Le Focaie  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Here's a 100% Sangiovese that offers aromas of blueberry, violet and a hint of thyme. The lively palate evokes red cherry, cinnamon and a balsamic note alongside smooth tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.

title: Steele 2016 Viognier (Lake County)
description: This is a light, appetizing style of a sometimes heavy varietal. Unique citrus and pine aromas lead to juicy, fresh and tangy flavors that range from lemon to honeysuckle. On the palate it's crisp and clean, lightly fruity and refreshing.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Grenache Blanc (Adelaida District)
description: Pineapple, candied mango and melon show on the plush, nearly tropical nose of this bottling. That ripeness dissipates a bit on the sip, where poached apple and pear flesh flavors rule.

title: The Four Graces 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: Succulent and fresh, this puts out clean crisp flavors of lemon-lime, grapefruit and a touch of white peach. It's nicely supported with ample juicy acidity. Put a slight chill on it and drink now through 2020.

title: Tormaresca 2016 Pietrabianca Chardonnay (Castel del Monte)
description: Aromas of citrus, sea spray and toast ride over a riper core of melon on the nose. This is expressive in fruit intensity and weight, offering a silken palate of juicy melon and citrus flavors, balanced by an integrated vein of acidity. A lightly charred lemon note lingers on the finish.

title: Villa Pinciana 2016 Airali White (Maremma Toscana)
description: A blend of 90% Vermentino and 10% Viognier, this opens with aromas of beeswax, acacia flower and citrus. The juicy palate offers up apricot, yellow peach and dried herb alongside bright acidity.

title: Wolfberger 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Only slight hints of ripe pear reach the nose. The palate offers more fruit and the textural element of pear peel. This is fresh clean and has a lovely mouthfeel. The finish is pristine.

title: Zeni 2016 Marogne  (Lugana)
description: Delicately enticing scents of spring blossom and white stone fruit drift out of the glass. The bright, rounded palate offers white peach, yellow apple and tangerine while fresh acidity lifts the creamy flavors.

title: 2Hawk 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)
description: Done in a ripe, rather chunky style, this has a fruit-forward mix of lemon, grapefruit and kiwi. It was half stainless and half barrel fermented, and finishes with a firm grip.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2016 Muscat (Alsace)
description: Honeysuckle, rosewater and fresh lime peel unite to create a very perfumed but fresh nose. The palate is intensely aromatic but remains light and fresh, there is a textural, pithy side to the fluid body.

title: Amalie Robert 2013 Amalie's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is essentially a barrel select winemaker's blend. Mixing oranges, raspberries and cherries in the fruit bowl, it has more palate weight than you might expect given the low alcohol. The tannins have a little extra grip, and leave a light trail of cocoa powder in the aftertaste.

title: Château Plantey 2015  Pauillac
description: This is a rare estate in Pauillac that is not classified but rather a crus bourgeois. Its blend, with more Merlot than Cabernet Sauvignon, is also unusual. The wine itself is ripe and structured, with plenty of the tannic character and black-currant fruit of young Pauillac. Drink from 2023.

title: Cosimo Taurino 2010 Notarpanaro Negroamaro (Salento)
description: This well-priced, aged wine offers aromas of brandied cherries, spiced game and herbs on the nose. Its round feel and soft tannins make it entirely approachable to drink on its own, while its savory palate and graphite finish make it a perfect accompaniment to braised lamb or duck. Drink now.

title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2016 Rosenberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Both lemon and ripe pear meet on the nose. It is the lemon notes that are foremost on the slender, dry palate. The finish is clean and moreish.
